subclusters.subcluster_name: ROS-Induced DNA Damage and Cellular Senescence Theory
DNA Repair Deficiency and Genome Instability Theory
Damage Accumulation and Repair Strategies Theory
DNA Content and Cellular Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS-Induced DNA Damage and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on reactive oxygen species causing DNA damage leading to cellular senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS-Induced DNA Damage and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes DNA damage accumulation in hematopoietic stem cells driven by ROS and telomere attrition causing senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS-Induced DNA Damage and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative stress-induced DNA damage and compensatory repair in immune cells leading to premature senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS-Induced DNA Damage and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative DNA damage accumulation in neurons causing impaired gene expression and brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS-Induced DNA Damage and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA damage accumulation from metabolic byproducts and exogenous sources causing cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS-Induced DNA Damage and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights DNA damage accumulation causing oxidative stress and vascular dysfunction in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS-Induced DNA Damage and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes DNA damage accumulation and stem cell exhaustion leading to tissue degeneration and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS-Induced DNA Damage and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes continuous DNA damage induction by endogenous and exogenous agents causing age-related DNA alterations.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair Deficiency and Genome Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA repair pathways, especially base excision repair, and their decline influencing aging and health span.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair Deficiency and Genome Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on genome instability from DNA damage accumulation and DNA repair deficiencies causing systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair Deficiency and Genome Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights decline in DNA repair capacity and genetic variants in repair genes influencing aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair Deficiency and Genome Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses genome instability from DNA damage accumulation and differential DNA repair pathways affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair Deficiency and Genome Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mutations in DNA repair genes causing genomic instability and segmental progeroid syndromes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair Deficiency and Genome Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genomic maintenance and DNA repair gene mutations as drivers of accelerated aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair Deficiency and Genome Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ATM kinase deficiency impairing DNA repair and causing premature immune system aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Damage Accumulation and Repair Strategies Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes comprehensive damage accumulation including DNA and other molecular damage with modular repair strategies.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Damage Accumulation and Repair Strategies Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on engineered repair of molecular damage including mitochondrial gene allotopic expression and lysosomal enzyme targeting.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Damage Accumulation and Repair Strategies Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Considers cellular damage accumulation broadly, including genetic and protein damage, linking aging and cancer.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Damage Accumulation and Repair Strategies Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes time-dependent accumulation of molecular damage and its systemic effects including inflammation and epigenetic changes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Content and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA:cytoplasm ratio dilution due to excessive cell growth causing transcriptional and translational limitations leading to senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Content and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes replication-driven functional drift through cumulative cell divisions altering cell function and tissue homeostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Content and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on failure of DNA replication initiation (G1/S transition) and decreased DNA polymerase alpha activity causing replicative senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Content and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights DNA replication stress causing DNA damage accumulation and aging, integrating growth signaling and ROS effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: rDNA Instability and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on rDNA loci instability, extrachromosomal rDNA circles, and replication fork barriers as drivers of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: rDNA Instability and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-dependent rDNA copy number variation and methylation linked to cellular senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: rDNA Instability and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details multi-layered spatial repair of rDNA damage and nuclear pore involvement in asymmetric damage segregation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Macromolecular Deterioration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of deleterious post-translational modifications in long-lived proteins impairing tissue function and aging.
